summary: AI assistant app focused on accessibility for disabled users, including an optional autistic-friendly communication mode and clear, plain-language answers that are easy for anyone to understand.

existing_features.title: When the user asks a cooking question (e.g., "how to bake cookies"), generate a structured, plain-English answer that is maximally helpful for a broad audience, using clear sections and step-by-step instructions rather than returning raw or loosely extracted snippets.

Enhance the cooking-response formatter so that extracted content is cleaned and normalized for readability (remove partial keyword context, avoid mid-sentence clipping, and avoid duplicating boilerplate), while preserving the existing ConversationThread structured-cooking rendering behavior.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add accessibility-focused features to assist disabled users (e.g., voice input/output, text-to-speech, and other assistive interactions)
Provide an optional autistic-friendly communication mode (direct, literal, low-ambiguity, structured responses) that users can switch on/off
Ensure answers are maximally helpful while remaining easy for anyone to understand (clear step-by-step plain-language explanations, e.g., for questions like baking cookies)

projectName: Improve cooking answers to be maximally helpful and easy to understand (e.g., baking cookies)
